greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Lexicographically earliest infinite sequence such that a(i) = a(j) => A278220(i) = A278220(j) for all i, j.
comment: Restricted growth sequence transform of A278220(n) (= A046523(A241909(n))).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
Index entries for sequences computed from indices in prime factorization
program: rgs_transform(invec) = { my(om = Map(), outvec = vector(length(invec)), u=1); for(i=1, length(invec), if(mapisdefined(om,invec[i]), my(pp = mapget(om, invec[i])); outvec[i] = outvec[pp] , mapput(om,invec[i],i); outvec[i] = u; u++ )); outvec; };
A046523(n) = { my(f=vecsort(factor(n)[, 2], , 4), p); prod(i=1, #f, (p=nextprime(p+1))^f[i]); };  \\ This function from A046523
A241909(n) = if(1==n||isprime(n),2^primepi(n),my(f=factor(n),h=1,i,m=1,p=1,k=1); while(k<=#f~, p = nextprime(1+p); i = primepi(f[k,1]); m *= p^(i-h); h = i; if(f[k,2]>1, f[k,2]--, k++)); (p*m));
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jan 17 2020
